Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Clean and tidy but very small.”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights early April 2012. Me, my wife and our daughter and her friend. Everywhere near the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square area is extremely expensive but we wanted to be central so had to pay (about 100 Euro's a night per room). Stayed in Venice a few times before on the Lido where you get much better value (and 3* or maybe 4*) but this trip we fancied a more central location and this was only 5 minutes walk to teh Rialto Bridge and about 10 minutes to St Marks. Ideal. Yes, our double room was small and the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen. But, it was all pretty clean. Yes, the walls are very thin and you can hear people whispering as they walked past your door but we slept well and it all felt pretty safe and I think we sampled the REAL VENICE ! The area around the Hotel was safe and quaint but it's a shame the bar next door wasn't a little cheaper too just for convenience. Americans will hate the fact that there is no ICE in the hotel at all, or air conditioning, or a safe, or a pool. In fact it is pretty basic and you can't really relax anywhere except maybe in the breakfast area. I can't fault the staff though, like any staff in any hotel BE NICE and they will do what they can. To summarise I think this hotel is a quaint place to stay. There's canals all around you, cute narrow alleyways, busy shops and very handy for all the sights. Come with LOW expectations and you won't be disappointed ;o) You'll pay a similar price for hotels nearer to the Train Station but that's a full 20 minutes further away and nowhere near as nice an area. I wanted to come away with some great memories of Venice not the Hotel, so for me... job done ! Would I come to this hotel again, yes I think I might.

Reviews.Title: “"value for money ???"”
Reviews.Author: JAS486
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days . Expensive.Room very basic and small .Shower flowed into the room each time I used it.Very basic Continental breakfast .Ok for an ovenight stay but not really suitable to stay any longer.No lift and reception on 3rd floor so getting a suitcase up the stairs a nightmare.Hotel staff very helpful.In a good location close to the Rialto Bridge and St Marks

Reviews.Title: “how much??!!!”
Reviews.Author: dana n
Reviews.Content: Perhaps we simply chose the wrong weekend to visit Venice. we paid 150 euro for a room (w/o bath) barely big enough to hold the double bed-2 steps out of bed and you were against the wall. and said wall was paper thin. there was little we couldn't hear. breakfast was adequate and pleasantly served and the location was great. the staff was very friendly and helpful, particularly the young woman from morocco. all in all though, a single mark against what was otherwise a great 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: Alice028
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada is a real find if you are looking for a well-placed, central hotel. It is reasonable in price and good for those on a budget. The main rooms are basic and somewhat hot as no air con but not bad value if you want to save your euro for the amazing sights of this truly unique city on the water. I had booked through Otel.com on line and thought I had booked the double (matrimonial) room with the terrace. I even rang Otel to check and they assured me I had this room. Something went wrong and on arrival I had two nights in the basic standard room. But the staff at Hotel Canada did everything to rectify this and for my remaining two nights they were able to move me to Room Dodici B. This was amazing, as you will see from my pics. The view of top of San Marco is good and the room is comfortable, elegant and has air con (10 euro extra) but with sufficient breeze I did not need it and it was height of Venezia heat, being July. The staff are lovely and so helpful and even type their correspondence on a proper typewriter. This is truly a very Italian Hotel and adds to the charm and beauty of good old fashioned times gone by. They could not do enough for me and made me feel welcome and not like a single lone traveller, although I did come with friends who stayed elsewhere. It is excellent location for centrale Venice... 5 to 10 min walk to San Marco and about same to the Rialto. Great for picking up Vapereto and also travelling back to San Marco airport. The square where Hotel Canada is located is charming and has lots of great bars, shops. Safe to walk around at night (quite late) as I did on my own. The whole Centre feels safe and unthreatening. The breakfast is fine and one of the best continental ones I have had in this type of hotel. Despite other reviewers complaints I found it to be satisfying. You get plenty of great Italian coffee, juice, pastries and rolls, nice selection of jams and cream cheese. But then I am often happier with this type of breakfast. If you want full English don't to Europe, stay at home. This is better and healthier. I would definitely stay here again. However I strongly recommend going for room Dodici B (Twelve B). Having said that the basic rooms were clean and comfortable. I had to leave very early am to catch vapereto to airport and the eve before on my return the concierge greeted me with a tray of breakfast things and jug of juice (some of which I drank as very hot). The hotel bar was very reasonable and the staff would obligingly get me drinks even when it was late on. I found this hotel as recommended in my little AA travel guidebook and through the online website and otel.com. I have stayed in everything from 5 to 2 star and I really do want to go back to my little Hotel Canada and bella Venezia (soon).

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in an exceptional location.”
Reviews.Author: PETAOXF
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada is a good budget find if your expectations are modest. The biggest draw of the hotel is its superb location close to Piazza San Marco and Rialto. Additionally, the hotel is surrounded by restaurants and fabulous gelaterie and there is an inexpensive supermarket only steps away. The hotelâ€™s twenty or so rooms are arranged over two floors. Some rooms have canal views whilst others look directly onto other buildings. The rooms themselves have tiled floors and are very basically furnished but are acceptable for the price. The 1970s bathrooms however, are badly in need of renovation (some have enclosed showers whilst others have a wet-room set-up). In our room, the water-pressure was abysmal. At best, it was very weak, and at worst (on at least two mornings), we had no water at allâ€”Iâ€™m not joking. Furthermore, our room was not all that cleanâ€”Iâ€™m sure the hotelâ€™s cleaning schedule only consists of changing the linen and giving the bathroom the quickest of wipe-overs: everything looked like it could have done with a good scrub (especially the mouldy shower). However, apart from these concerns, we liked our light-filled room (that was not without charm) and its small terrace nestled amongst the Venetian rooftops. Avoid the breakfast if you can though, as it is truly atrocious. On offer were hard stale-tasting bread rolls, soggy â€˜airline-styleâ€™ croissants and imitation orange juice. Coffee and tea is made to orderâ€”we asked for hot-chocolates and received an undrinkable brew. The breakfast room which overlooks the small square below, is pleasant enough, but spoilt by the noise of the TV (showing the news). I would recommend Hotel Canada to those on a tight budget despite the issues I have mentioned as the rooms are far from unpleasant, the rates are cheap, the location is great and the people working in the hotel are very nice. To get here from the Santa Lucia station, catch the vaporetto to Ponte di Rialtoâ€”itâ€™s a short walk from there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay - good location”
Reviews.Author: arn22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. No-nonsense staff. Breakfast was nice, not spectacular. Good location, easy to get to San Marco and Rialto (5 minutes or so walk). Not much privacy in rooms since other rooms are very close by. Good if you only want a place to spend the night and are not looking at anything more. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pass”
Reviews.Author: monkeytea
Reviews.Content: Reviews seemed ok. on this hotel so we stayed there to save on hotel cost. Our friends had to switch rooms because there was mold on the ceiling. Overall feeling was dirty and the breakfast seemed stale.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: ibbyCalif
Reviews.Content: Clerk says they don't have website . They keep track of the room inventory on a handwritten chart. You book via GTA in Turkey. Whoever coined the expression "buyer beware " must have dealt w these guys (GTA). When we arrived, we were told they could not give us 2 rooms. They jammed 4 of us in 1 room by setting up 2 cots. It was so tight you could not open closet. Had a heated debate w mgr via phone. They compensated us in cash on the spot. Don't be put off by this, this hotel does a lot of things right. I would call hotel directly to verify availability since GTA and hotel did not e mail of call us to tell us they couldn't totally honor reservation. Staff was very efficent , quickly responded to any request. Nobody smiled except the guy who showed us how to work the ac and the clerk who I gave a bad time at check in. Breakfast was very basic,bread, bread, and more bread plus coffee/juice. INCLUDED IN COST OF ROOM. Tried to charge us 10 euros for air conditioning remote control, they waived it when I protested .Room was small, simple and clean except for calcium deposits on shower door. No tv in room. Some rooms have a view, this one (rm 15) did not. Our room a bit loud, it was near reception area. Floors were tile, it made even footsteps seem loud. Other parts of hotel were quieter.Only 1 way in /out , did not see fire escape. No elevator. 30 plus steps up 3 flights from street to reception, forget about this place if you are handicapped. Next to "Irish" pub Volare. In corner of plaza, ez to miss. HAS LOCATION , LOCATION, LOCATION! Steps from Rialto bridge and vaporetto stop. Ez walk to ST Mark's and lots of shops/eatreries.They have a pocket size map at the desk, very useful. If you stay out late, be advised they close at 2am. Leave key at desk when you go out. It is a heavy old style skeleton key. They have a safe at desk, I would use it for valuables. Use Ronald Reagan approach w your reservation, trust, but verify. Other than than reservation snafu, not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: Barry Wood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for two nights in mid-December. All the staff we encountered were very pleasant and eager to please, and the room we were given was spacious enough and had a view of a small canal outside (which I had requested when booking). Unlike another reviewer, we had no problems with the bathroom or shower, which was in an enclosed unit in the corner. Breakfast was basic, but adequate to start the day. We did, however, glimpse a couple of other rooms, facing the front of the hotel, which appeared to be not much larger than the bed, so beware and ask for a larger room. The location is fantastic, within a couple of minutes of the Rialto Bridge and seconds from many shops and restaurants. There is also a so-called Irish pub next door, although the Irishness doesn't in fact extend to more than having a couple of Irish beers on tap. Venice presents a unique challenge, though, in that you cannot get a taxi to the front door of your hotel. We encountered many tourists wheeling suitcases and looking confused in the narrow lanes, as were we upon our arrival. I suggest, as we did, that if possible you check in some of your luggage at the airport and just take what you need for your stay into Venice itself. In that regard, the 'map' that the hotel provides on its website is hopelessly inadequate, made to look old in line with the location, when a clear and simple street/lane layout would be much better. Once you know the way from the Rialto waterbus stop, it is a simple two minute walk. Booking months in advance, we paid 90 Euros a night, which was superb value, and I would certainly stay there again. Two days in Venice, though, is enough, so instead I'll just recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: lac_11
Reviews.Content: The only thing positive to say about this hotel is the location, which was excellent. However, everything else was lacking. The tiny room had a shower without an enclosure so that you basically have a shower spraying you as you stand crowded against the toilet. The room was very hot, with no air-conditioning. The walls were thin and the doors thinner, so that you heard every noise outside your room in the halls and neighboring rooms. Breakfast was a stale croissant. It rained very hard while we were there, and our room flooded completely. All our things were soaked, and they did not seem the slightest bit interested in trying to compensate us in any way for the inconvenience. We carried our own things from the very small room to an even smaller room barely large enough to hold the full sized bed. I would NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: jem5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 2004. We thought this hotel was a great find. The location was fantastic, next to Realto Bridge and not far from St Marks Square. There were lots of restaurants close by and a bar right next to the hotel. The hotel itself was basic, but very clean and all we needed as we were out exploring most of the time. As previously mentioned breakfast wasn't great - a dry croissant and coffee, but there are plenty of places for snacks in Venice. Venice was fabulous and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 1999, and enjoyed it. We had the room with the roof garden (there is only one) which made it very nice to sit and enjoy the outside. Campo san Lio is really festive, and nicely located. If I had any complaint it was the breakfest......definately not what we were used to anywhere else in Europe, including Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canada is located in Campo S. Lio which is very closed to Rialto, almost at the heart of Venice. Looking over a nice little square with an Irisih pub and a Cafe, I think this is one of the most beautiful accomodation you can get for a little money. There are double rooms with private bathroom for about 70 euro including breakfast! Only downside is that they close the doors at 2AM at night.
